attributes.action: divert money from green taxes on petrol and diesel to carbon offsetting schemes
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Typical carbon offset programmes claim that offsetting carbon production from privately owned cars can be done at a cost of around £25.

The "typical motorist" was defined to be someone who 

drives his/her car in such a way that it averages 35 mpg, and drives 10,000 miles per year.

The CO2 produced is estimated at 3 tonnes.

However, 10,000 miles / 35 mpg = 286 gallons or thereabouts.

If petrol is about £4 a gallon (so we're only paying £3 or 300% tax on it) the tax charged is £858 or thereabouts.

As it only represents 0.03% of the revenue raised, could the government please lead the way on CO2 emissions offsetting by spending £25 out of this £858 on offsetting the carbon produced by "typical" motorists ?
